name: Deduction for foreign-derived intangible income derived from trade or business within the United States
objective: Under the baseline tax system, the United States taxes income earned by U.S. corporations from serving foreign markets (e.g., exports and royalties) at the full U.S. rate. After the passage of TCJA, domestic corporations are allowed a deduction equal to 37.5 percent of “foreign-derived intangible income,” which is essentially
